metadata.Title: CVE-2020-25695 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in PostgreSQL versions before 13.1, before 12.5, before11.10, before 10.15, before 9.6.20 and before 9.5.24. An attacker havingpermission to create non-temporary objects in at least one schema canexecute arbitrary SQL functions under the identity of a superuser. Thehighest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality andintegrity as well as system availability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-25695` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libecpg-compat3 - 12.5-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libecpg6 - 12.5-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libpgtypes3 - 12.5-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libpq5 - 12.5-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
postgresql-12 - 12.5-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
postgresql-client-12 - 12.5-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
postgresql-plperl-12 - 12.5-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
postgresql-plpython3-12 - 12.5-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
postgresql-pltcl-12 - 12.5-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: postgresql-12 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '12.5-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
